opinion.syllabus: MOTIONS, CLARIFICATION — CIRCUIT COURT PROCEEDINGS STAYED PENDING RESOLUTION OF THE MATTERS ON APPEAL. — Upon consideration of appellees' motion for clarification and appellant's response thereto, and for good cause shown, the supreme court clarified that all proceedings in the circuit court were to be stayed pending resolution of the matters on appeal; in other words, all parties were admonished to maintain the status quo.
opinion.posture: Motion for Clarification or Reconsideration; motion for clarification granted.
opinion.opinion_text:
On November 1, 2007, Appellant John David Terry filed a motion for suspension or stay of order. Appellees, John A. White, Chancellor of the University of Arkansas, Fayetteville, and B. Alan Sugg, President of the University of Arkansas System, timely filed a response to the motion. On November 8, 2007, this court issued a summary order granting Appellant's motion for suspension or stay of order. Now before the court is Appellees' motion for clarification or reconsideration of the court's November 8, 2007 order.
[1] Upon consideration of Appellees' motion for clarification and Appellant's response thereto, and for good cause shown, we hereby clarify that all proceedings in the circuit court are stayed pending resolution of the matters on appeal. In other words, all parties are admonished to maintain the status quo.Page 666
